Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.dns

Class DNSResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.dns.DNSResolver
  • public class DNSResolver
extends java.lang.Object
    Asynchronous DNS resolver using non-blocking I/O.

    DNSResolver provides non-blocking DNS lookups with callback-based result delivery. It is designed for use in event-driven applications.

    Queries are sent to configured upstream DNS servers and responses are delivered via the DNSQueryCallback interface. Timeout handling is integrated with the Gumdrop scheduler.

    Example usage: 

    
 DNSResolver resolver = new DNSResolver();
 resolver.addServer("8.8.8.8");
 resolver.open();

 resolver.queryTXT("_dmarc.example.com", new DNSQueryCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onResponse(DNSMessage response) {
         for (DNSResourceRecord rr : response.getAnswers()) {
             if (rr.getType() == DNSType.TXT) {
                 String txt = rr.getTxtData();
                 // Process TXT record...
             }
         }
     }

     @Override
     public void onError(String error) {
         // Handle timeout or error
     }
 });
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    DNSQueryCallback

    • Constructor Detail

      • DNSResolver

        public DNSResolver()
        Creates a new DNS resolver with no servers configured. Call addServer(String) or addServer(InetAddress, int) to add DNS servers before opening.

    • Method Detail

      • addServer

        public void addServer​(java.lang.String server)
               throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Adds a DNS server by hostname or IP address. Uses the default DNS port (53).

        This method should be called during configuration, before open(). For IP address strings (e.g., "8.8.8.8"), no network lookup is performed. For hostnames, a blocking DNS lookup occurs.

        Parameters:
        server - the server hostname or IP address
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the hostname cannot be resolved

      • addServer

        public void addServer​(java.lang.String server,
                      int port)
               throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Adds a DNS server by hostname or IP address with a specific port.

        This method should be called during configuration, before open(). For IP address strings, no network lookup is performed. For hostnames, a blocking DNS lookup occurs.

        Parameters:
        server - the server hostname or IP address
        port - the port number
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the hostname cannot be resolved

      • addServer

        public void addServer​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                      int port)
        Adds a DNS server by InetAddress.

        This is the preferred method when you already have the address, as it avoids any potential blocking DNS lookup.

        Parameters:
        address - the server address
        port - the port number

      • setTimeoutMs

        public void setTimeoutMs​(long timeoutMs)
        Sets the query timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - the timeout in milliseconds

      • useSystemResolvers

        public void useSystemResolvers()
        Adds the system's default DNS resolvers. This reads from /etc/resolv.conf on Unix-like systems.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the resolver by creating connections to all configured servers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a connection cannot be opened

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the resolver and all connections.

        Queries for PTR records (reverse DNS).
        Parameters:
        name - the domain name to query (e.g., "1.0.0.127.in-addr.arpa")
        callback - the callback to receive results
